data.meta_site_name: County of Hawai‘i Department of Environmental Management
data.text:
Nearest HI5 Redemption Center

The Hawai‘i Deposit Beverage Container Program (HI-5) is a State of Hawai‘i funded program that places a 5¢ redeemable deposit on each qualified beverage container. Why throw away your recyclables when the HI-5 program has more than 15 convenient redemption centers island wide. Just look for the HI 5¢ label on your glass, plastic and metal containers, and take them to any redemption center to get cash back and help protect the environment at the same time.

INSTRUCTIONS:

NO CAPS: Please remove the caps from the bottles. Pursuant to Hawai’i Administrative Rules Section 11-282-61, caps should not be included when redeeming by weight. Also caps may be made of different materials and currently not collected for recycling by Hawai`i County. Please toss your caps in the rubbish.

Look for the HI-5 mark on beverage containers: soft drinks, soda, juice, tea, coffee drinks, water, beer, malt beverages, mixed spirits and wine coolers in metal, glass or plastic containers up to 68 fluid ounces.

They must be empty of liquid and debris removed.

Please leave the HI-5 label visible on beverage containers, usually located on the top of aluminum cans and the container label on the plastic and glass bottles. If the label falls off, it can be placed inside the container with the HI-5 label visible.

Please separate your containers prior to arriving at the recycling center. Containers must be separated by type: glass, plastic, aluminum, bi-metal.

SAVE SPACE! FLATTENED ALUMINUM AND PLASTIC CONTAINERS ARE ACCEPTED.

Take your HI-5 beverage containers to the Nearest HI5 Redemption Center for your refund!

For more information: go to www.health.hawaii.gov/hi5

Locations & Hours:

WEST HAWAI‘I LOCATIONS AND HOURS

Please note: All County Recycling & Transfer Stations are closed on New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas Day.

Keauhou Recycling & Transfer Station **CLOSED Saturday July 20, 2024**

Saturday and Sunday 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Atlas Recycling:

74-5600 Alapa Street, Kailua-Kona (Old Industrial Area)

Monday to Friday, 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.; Saturday & Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

EAST HAWAI‘I LOCATIONS AND HOURS

Please note: All County Recycling & Transfer Stations are closed on New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas Day.

Kea‘au Recycling & Transfer Station

16-921 Kea‘au-Pāhoa Rd., Kea‘au

Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Atlas Recycling:

Industrial Area Location

30 Maka‘ala Street, Hilo

Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; Saturday & Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Waiānuenue Location **

191 Waiānuenue Ave, Hilo (next to Blane’s) –

Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.; Saturday 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Business Services Hawai‘i

Pāhoa Location

Pāhoa Village Road (across from Post Office)

Open daily, 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Shipman Industrial Location

16-630 Kipimana Street, Kea‘au

Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Mr. K’s Recycle & Redemption 815 Kino‘ole St., Hilo (next to K’s Drive-In & Kadota Liquors)

Open daily, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

NORTH HAWAI‘I LOCATIONS AND HOURS

Please note: All County Recycling & Transfer Stations are closed on New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas Day.

Hāwī (Ka‘auhuhu) Recycling & Transfer Station

Saturdays & Sundays 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Honoka‘a Recycling & Transfer Station

Saturdays & Sundays 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Puakō Recycling & Transfer Station

Sundays ONLY 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Atlas Recycling

64-1004 Māmalahoa Hwy, Waimea

Monday, Wednesday, Friday 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

SOUTH HAWAI‘I LOCATIONS AND HOURS

Please note: All County Recycling & Transfer Stations are closed on New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas Day.
